llama2:70b_direct_sole-planning_results:
Day 1 (March 16th): Salt Lake City to Billings

* Fly from Salt Lake City to Billings on F3536653, departing at 22:36 and arriving at 23:41.
* Check-in at a hotel in downtown Billings that allows parties and has good reviews.
* Dine at a nearby American restaurant for dinner.

Day 2 (March 17th): Explore Billings

* After breakfast, take a taxi to the Yellowstone Art Museum to explore its collection of contemporary art.
* Next, visit the Moss Mansion Historic House Museum to learn about the history of Billings.
* For lunch, try a Mediterranean restaurant in the city.
* In the afternoon, visit the Zoo Montana to see various animals from around the world.
* Return to your hotel and rest before heading out for dinner at a local Chinese restaurant.

Day 3 (March 18th): Billings to Great Falls

* Take a taxi to the airport and fly on F3500804 from Billings to Great Falls, departing at 05:57 and arriving at 07:03.
* Check-in at a hotel in downtown Great Falls that allows parties and has good reviews.
* For breakfast, try a local café or bakery.
* Visit the C.M. Russell Museum to learn about the area's history and art.
* Have lunch at an Indian restaurant in the city.
* In the afternoon, take a stroll along the Missouri River and visit the Great Falls of the Missouri.
* For dinner, try a local steakhouse or seafood restaurant.

Day 4 (March 19th): Explore Great Falls

* After breakfast, visit the Lewis and Clark Interpretive Center to learn about the famous explorers' journey.
* Next, take a taxi to the Great Falls International Airport to rent a car for the day.
* Drive to the nearby Ulm Pishkun State Park to hike and enjoy the scenic views of the Missouri River.
* Return your rental car at the end of the day and head back to your hotel.
* Dine at a local seafood restaurant for dinner.

Day 5 (March 20th): Great Falls to Bozeman

* Take a taxi to the airport and fly on F3513324 from Great Falls to Bozeman, departing at 13:08 and arriving at 14:24.
* Check-in at a hotel in downtown Bozeman that allows parties and has good reviews.
* For lunch, try a local Mediterranean restaurant.
* Visit the Museum of the Rockies to learn about Montana's natural history and dinosaurs.
* In the afternoon, take a stroll through the historic downtown area and visit some local shops and galleries.
* For dinner, try a local brewery or winery for dinner.

Day 6 (March 21st): Explore Bozeman

* After breakfast, take a taxi to the Bridger Bowl Ski Resort to enjoy a day of skiing or snowboarding.
* Alternatively, visit the Gallatin River for some fishing or rafting.
* Return to your hotel and rest before heading out for dinner at a local American restaurant.

Day 7 (March 22nd): Departure from Bozeman

* Take a taxi to the airport and fly back to Salt Lake City on F3805464, departing at 18:32 and arriving at 19:54.
* Upon arrival, take a taxi or shuttle to your hotel and rest before heading out for a farewell dinner at a local restaurant.

Budget Breakdown:

* Flights: $1,050 (based on the prices mentioned in the itinerary)
* Accommodations (7 nights): $1,400 (avg. $200 per night)
* Transportation (taxis and shuttles): $150
* Food and dining: $1,200 (avg. $170 per day for meals and snacks)
* Activities and entrance fees: $300 (estimated cost for visits to museums, historical sites, skiing/snowboarding, etc.)
* Miscellaneous expenses (souvenirs, tips, etc.): $250

Total budget: $7,200
